## All scrollytelling has... {.center .hcenter background-image="images/bg.png"}

Elements that **stay on the page** and update as **text scrolls by**

## ... but it might also have: {.center .hcenter background-image="images/bg.png"}

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column}
Graphic transitions

Animations

Sounds
:::
::: {.column}
Maps

Movies

Chart build-ups
:::
::::

## (or it might not!) {.center .hcenter background-image="images/bg.png"}

These examples often take entire teams to build!

:::{.small .deepmh}
Data journalism • Engineering • Design • Reporting • Editing
:::

## Quarto {.center .hcenter background-image="images/bg.png"}

takes care of a lot of web publishing fundamentals

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column}
[Raw HTML]{.small .deemph}
![](images/webpage-1.png){alt="Screenshot of an article, written as basic semantic HTML"}
:::
::: {.column}
[Quarto output]{.small .deemph}
![](images/webpage-2.png){alt="Screenshot of same article as output by Quarto"}
:::
::::


## But scrollytelling requires even more engineering {.center .hcenter background-image="images/bg.png"}

:::{.small .deemph}
**Detecting** whether things are on screen  
  
**Transitioning** between elements  
  
**Sizing and positioning** content [(on various phones, tablets and browsers!)]{.small .deemph}  
  
Drawing **attention** to elements on the page  
  
**Playing and synchronising** videos
:::

Most of these elements are built bespoke for each story

## What else is out there? {.center .hcenter background-image="images/bg.png"}

Commercial solutions!  
[But they're expensive]{.small .deemph}  
[And not very flexible]{.small .deemph}  
[And rarely work with the tools data folk use]{.small .deemph}

## Ingredients of a Closeread {.center .hcenter background-image="images/bg.png"}

Use Quarto cross-references to build a story

\

::::: {.columns .small .deemph}
:::: {.column}
**Stickies** are things that stick on the page.

````
:::{#cr-example}
I want to show this off!
:::
````

::::
:::: {.column}
**Triggers** scroll past normally and make stickies appear or change.

````
Look at this... @cr-example
````

::::
:::::

## Common themes {.center .hcenter background-image="images/bg.png"}

Less is more  
[1–2 sentences on screen at a time]{.small .deemph}

You still need a compelling story  
[But that doesn't necessarily mean prize-winning research!]{.small .deemph}

Build things up  
[Introduce one layer/facet/group at a time]{.small .deemph}
